com.addith.quantum

Class QuantumRegister

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.addith.quantum.QuantumRegister
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    QuantumRegisterInterface

    public class QuantumRegister
extends java.lang.Object
implements QuantumRegisterInterface
    This class represents the quantum register. It holds 2^K the quantum states where K is the size/number of Qubits on this register. Register is the "Receiver" implementation for our command design pattern. It knows how to perform the operations associated with the Quantum Operations requested via the quantum operations implementing the Quantum Operation Command. Design pattern: Command

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      QuantumRegister(int size)
      Creates a register of n qubits, initialized to the state |0>.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void applyHadamard()
      Transform register directly, apply hadamard operation to all Q states of this register, where Q = 2 ^ K and K is the numberOfQubits of the register.
      void applyInitialState()
      Apply initial state to this register.
      int getMeasuredValue()
      Gets the measured value.
      int getNumberOfQubits()
      Gets the number of qubits.

      Gets the number of states stored.

      Gets the states.

      Measure the register and return the random value of a quantum measurement of this register.
      QuantumRegisterInterface performModularExponentiation(QuantumRegister targetRegister, int a, int n)
      Applies the modular exponentiation function to the contents of source register and store the result in target register.
      void quantumFourierTransform()
      Applies the quantum Fourier transform (QFT) to all states of this register.This is applied to the states itself and not what it holds.

      Sets the measured value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • QuantumRegister

        public QuantumRegister(int size)
                throws ExceedsMaxQuibitsSupportedException
        Creates a register of n qubits, initialized to the state |0>. A register of numberOfQubits n enables a total of q = 2 n quantum states as the computational basis.
        Parameters:
        size - the size
        Throws:
        ExceedsMaxQuibitsSupportedException - the exceeds max quibits supported exception

      • measure

        public int measure()
        Description copied from interface: QuantumRegisterInterface
        Measure the register and return the random value of a quantum measurement of this register. Measurement makes the register collapse randomly to one of the qubits i.e. after a "measurement" has been made, one state should equal 1, and the rest should be zero. To implement the random collapse, a random number between 0 and 1 is chosen and squared probabilities of the each qubits are subtracted from the random number till it becomes zero or negative.The qubit that causes this is the measured value.
        Specified by:
        measure in interface QuantumRegisterInterface
        Returns:
        the measured value

      • performModularExponentiation

        public QuantumRegisterInterface performModularExponentiation(QuantumRegister targetRegister,
                                                             int a,
                                                             int n)
        Description copied from interface: QuantumRegisterInterface
        Applies the modular exponentiation function to the contents of source register and store the result in target register.
        Specified by:
        performModularExponentiation in interface QuantumRegisterInterface
        Parameters:
        targetRegister - the target register where the function values are stored, this will modify the target register
        a - the random base a
        n - the number being factored
        Returns:
        the target register after the function has been applied

        public void quantumFourierTransform()
        Description copied from interface: QuantumRegisterInterface

        Specified by:
